body:
For context, because we probably didn't ever explain it for @andymikulski: Firefox has a [code review policy](https://wiki.mozilla.org/Firefox/Code_Review) that ties in with the [module system](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/about/governance/policies/module-ownership/) we use for governance of Mozilla the organization (vs Mozilla the company). In particular, Firefox code (including our system add-on) must be reviewed by a peer of the Firefox module, and no one on our team is one. Luckily, @gijsk is one, has previous experience with the system SHIELD is replacing, and is an all-around great person, and graciously accepted our request to handle code reviews.

For add-on code reviews, we generally have two reviewers: @gijsk, and someone from the Normandy team. We still do the reviews on Github, though. Occasionally, @rhelmer handles reviews as well, mostly for stuff related to our use of the AddonManager in Firefox, which he maintains.
